oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-03-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 12, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer), guest performers the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1066th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Morgan; Jordanaires; Wilburn Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces George Morgan -- Chattanoogie Shoeshine Boy (George Morgan) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces the Jordanaires -- Swing Down Sweet Chariot (Jordanaires) -- George Morgan introduces the Wilburn Brothers -- Sentenced To Die (Wilburn Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Gooden (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and George Morgan talk -- Whispering Hope (George Morgan, Jordanaires) -- George Morgan introduces Chet Atkins -- Caravan (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jordanaires (Musical group); Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Wiggins, Roy; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Wilburn Brothers; Wilburn, Teddy; Wilburn, Doyle; Husky, Ferlin
